page.title: 05DERELICT SHOPS-RAYNES PARK
page.content: With the development of modern supermarkets,people with small business in Raynes Park find themselves being forced to end their trading because of the low prices supermarkets offer. We also found that many of the empty shops were toy or model shops,so it seems that people do not have the time or money for these any more or are getting them from larger department stores. With some unemployment in this area,some young people cannot afford such 'luxuries'. The shops ,even those which are still open do not seem to do much trade. They are old buildings and are fairly tatty and dirty both inside and out. There is dust from the roads and the railways and only newly established shops and offices seem to be able to afford the rents for the new buildings.
